hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When a major crypto catalyst (regulatory, macro, or institutional) triggers a >5% intraday move followed by 48 hours of compressed volatility (<50% of pre-news ATR), the subsequent breakout in the direction of the original catalyst move will yield 1.5x the initial move within 5 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Major catalysts create structural shifts in market positioning. The initial move shakes out weak hands, followed by institutional accumulation/distribution during compression. The breakout represents consensus formation and trend continuation.
entry_conditions: Major catalyst event (Fed decision, ETF approval/rejection, regulatory ruling) causes >5% BTC move
48-hour post-move volatility compression: 2-day ATR < 50% of 5-day pre-news ATR
Price consolidates within 61.8% Fibonacci retracement of initial move
Breakout above/below compression range with >1.5x average daily volume

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Break of opposite side of compression range + 0.5% buffer

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout direction is opposite to initial catalyst move >60% of time, or compression periods >72 hours fail to produce meaningful follow-through.
